architectural_decisions.title: Use of Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security.

architectural_decisions.title: Employment of Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access layer and provide CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Implementation of Dependency Injection
architectural_decisions.rationale: To manage dependencies effectively, such as the current user and payment processor.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling Using HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle various error scenarios appropriately.

architectural_decisions.title: Multi-Provider Payment Processing Support
architectural_decisions.rationale: To offer flexibility in payment options.

architectural_decisions.title: JWT Token-based Authentication
architectural_decisions.rationale: To securely authenticate clients and enforce authorization.

architectural_decisions.title: ORM Usage for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and improve code readability.

architectural_decisions.title: Email Confirmation on Order Creation
architectural_decisions.rationale: To notify customers about their newly created orders.

components.name: orders.py
components.description: Provides REST API endpoints for order management.

components.name: processor.py
components.description: Handles payment processing for the e-commerce API.

Create a New Order.description: This endpoint allows users to create a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.

steps.description: Include request body with items, shipping address, and payment method
Handle response containing order_id, status, total, items, created_at
Handle errors: HTTPException with status code 400 for validation failure; HTTPException with status code 500 for payment processing failure

Get Order Details.description: This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific order by its ID. Users can only access their own orders.

steps.description: Provide order_id as a path parameter
Handle response containing order_id, status, total, items, created_at
Handle errors: HTTPException with status code 404 for order not found; HTTPException with status code 403 for unauthorized access

List User Orders.description: This endpoint lists all orders for the current user, supporting pagination via limit and offset parameters.

steps.description: Include query parameters limit and offset for pagination
Handle response containing list of orders with order_id, status, total, items, created_at
Handle error: HTTPException with status code 400 for invalid parameters

Cancel an Order.description: This endpoint allows users to cancel a pending order. Orders that are processing or shipped cannot be cancelled.

steps.description: Provide order_id as a path parameter
Handle response message indicating order cancellation success
Handle errors: HTTPException with status code 404 for order not found; HTTPException with status code 403 for unauthorized access; HTTPException with status code 400 for invalid order status
